abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcone is rated as
            satisfactory, with project sustainability likely. Both World
            Bank and Borrower performances are assessed as satisfactory.
            Lessons learned included the following: Putting resources in
            the hands of directors at the individual research units
            increased efficiency, created greater diversification and
            breadth and enhanced disciplinary specialization and depth.
            A peer review process can be developed and used which, in a
            transparent and consistent manner, can review proposals and
            allocated funds in a way that is perceived by the academic
            community to be fair and equitable. Providing seed money for
            young scholars who received degrees aboard kept them in
            their institutions engaged in research and teaching rather
            than losing them to the domestic consultants industry. Small
            amounts of funds used to upgrade staff from remote
            institutions allows them to compete for entry into more
            prestigious institutions and this is a more successful
            approach than offering incentives to graduates from premier
            institutions. Project management must be treated with the
            same level of seriousness and professional judgment as is
            selection of research program directors. The proper
            selection and continuous training of project management
            staff is of critical importance to running scientific
            research units and avoiding the type of financial problem
            that developed at the end of the project.
